The claim originated from a Facebook pos: a known conspiracy theorist, who claimed to have learned from an unnamed source that "antifa" activists had rented seven buses to infiltrate the pro-gun rally in Richmond, Virginia and commit acts of violence.
The claim was widely spread by conspirat: wing websites, citing Deweese's Facebook post as their only source of information.
The Virginia pro: gun rally on MLK Day 2020 had approximately 22,000 demonstrators, organized by a self-described extremist, but there were no official reports of any major violence or fights at the event.
The expert: s verdict concludes that the claim is false, as there is no evidence to support the existence of busloads of undercover antifa activists at the rally, and the sole source of the claim is unreliable.
